urls.title: Walleys Quarry Landfill Site - Latest Update - Environment Agency - Citizen Space
urls.description: Find and participate in consultations run by the Environment Agency

tweets.text:
‼️🚨 WALLEY'S - CONFIRMED BREACH OF SITE PERMIT 🚨‼️

The @EnvAgencyMids have confirmed a breach of the site permit. This is very concerning.

Clearly the odour *is* causing annoyance. I will continue to put the pressure on with the EA and at Westminster.

https://t.co/9vl5xaQgzq https://t.co/Cae8tqcrf3

So sad but true @thameswater. If @DefraWater @EnvAgency @Ofwat and the water companies really focused on sorting out #sewage pollution, it could be done a lot quicker than the 5-year plans. But is there a will? https://t.co/TZTwgANupQ

We were out with @MPSBromley stopping waste vehicles in #Bromley. We are making sure all their waste is going to the right place.

To help make sure your waste isn't #flytipped
➡️ Ask to see their waste carriers licence
➡️ Don't pay in cash
➡️ Ask where they're taking the waste https://t.co/e2Fhhg37S4

Despite a lost year we still have achieved some good stuff on the Dour. Here's to the summer where more can be done.We hope in April (after trout have successfully bred) to be back safe guarding Our Finest Dour through tasks & education @HeritageFundL_S @WildTroutTrust @WCCPnews https://t.co/muKA6jzEvb

📢How should the water sector tackle the challenges of the future?   
   
🏴󠁧󠁢󠁥󠁮󠁧󠁿We've launched a public consultation on our Vision for the whole water sector in England by 2050 and are interested in hearing your views  
  
ℹ️ Have your say: https://t.co/kYAD6BqGh0 https://t.co/y5ubqqDlKx
@SimonTagg @NewsNBC @EnvAgencyMids @StinkStopthe https://t.co/4faGOaIOZe

What an absolute hero @ben_watt is.

An eloquent, penetrating, insightful and painfully accurate account of the failure by @CanalRiverTrust, @EnvAgency, @BarnetCouncil, @Brent_Council  and @NaturalEngland to safeguard the Welsh Harp SSSI.

Neglect and death by committee. https://t.co/l3STW0SZOQ

urls.title: Climate crisis hitting 'worst case scenarios', warns Environment Agency
urls.description: Sir James Bevan says extreme flooding in UK indicates urgent need for change if humanity is to survive

tweets.text:
From ‘hitting worst-case scenario levels’ to a warning that this is ‘not science fiction’.  Another alarming call by Sir James Bevan, Chief Executive of @EnvAgency.   

The #ClimateEmergency can no longer be left unchecked: https://t.co/bhe6anoxFS #COP26

tweets.text: 🚨Extraordinary. Latest statement by   @EnvAgencyMids relating to the foul odours FROM Walleys Quarry LandFill. https://t.co/d231VXevQS https://t.co/Jx7eUsURgp

The ongoing failure of @EnvAgencyMids to manage the situation at Walley's Quarry is no better represented than the failure of monitoring equipment to even be operational at the current time. https://t.co/M2TQjDFtba
@SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids No chance that was water. Water couldn’t make that smell inconsistently.

My first public meeting tonight, re: Welsh Harp SSSI neglect.
Astounded at the doublespeak & circumlocution. 
Appalled at how much money is wasted. 
Angered at the lack of accountability by organisations in charge incl. @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency 
Citizens must act and monitor. https://t.co/btZLt2rlPp

We have been out taking water samples on the River Blackwater just outside of #Maldon

We take routine samples at various locations to check water quality and the health of our watercourses👍 #Essex #Water https://t.co/pGWYWczj8X

More sites are underway for the Banks and the Braches project. 

We are working with our partners @HolmeRiver and @treesponsibilit to deliver 20,605 trees, which will be planted across multiple sites in west Yorkshire. 

#Treeplanting #EAEnvironmentProgramme https://t.co/q4DPu823U6

A special meeting of @NewsNBC will take place 18th March to discuss odours / Walleys Quarry Landfill and the poor response of @EnvAgencyMids it will be broadcast live on YouTube. @StinkStopthe 👇 https://t.co/xJOb9B5Foc

tweets.text:
After the emergency repair works to #BlackPotts weir, we successfully operated the #Jubilee River in December and in February, following the heavy rain.
✅We've restarted the repair works.
✅We've surveyed first phase of repairs to ensure no damage.
#floodaware https://t.co/c9TpB9aJy8

Thank you to Stoke North, Kidsgrove and Talke MP Jonathan Gullis for his letter to the Environment Minster about ‘Walleys Quarry landfill odour complaints and the inadequate response of @EnvAgencyMids “ https://t.co/4MCvCGnq33

Newly completed #floodplain reconnection project on Dunston Beck, Lincs, turning former arable field into diverse wetland & meadow habitats. #Partnership managed by WTT's Tim Jacklin along with landowners @beeswaxfarming and funding partner @EnvAgencyMids

Now & then shots https://t.co/O8xhJ6pvgK https://t.co/rBoSg6oazw

Stopping #WasteCrime helps to protect the environment and businesses too.

Our Environmental Crime Officer talks about the effects from waste crime that she sees every day in our latest blog.

Read it now: https://t.co/egpounEgVq https://t.co/e0Ek991NTn

urls.title: Royal Geographical Society - Why you should study geography
urls.description: Geographers are among the most employable university graduates. Find out more reasons why you should study geography.

tweets.text: "An understanding of how people and the environment interact is at the heart of what I do" - Dr Richard Jeffries #CGeog, Principal Geomorphologist @EnvAgency, uses geomorphology to plan river restoration and assess hydropower impacts https://t.co/61xMe9Muts #IntGeomorphWeek2021 https://t.co/AypzshQBW3

tweets.text: @EnvAgency @KarenShackleto5 Errrr......what? 🤔

So pleased to see this fantastic project completed @beeswaxfarming working collaboratively with @WildTroutTrust @EnvAgencyMids looking forward to monitoring the benefits of this project 🐝 🐟🌱 #floodplain #landmanagement #environment #farming #landscape #collaboration https://t.co/SsLzXgHazo

We are out on the River Parrett today and Monday taking surveys as part of the #Bridgwater Tidal Barrier scheme. The surveys are being undertaken by AP Land Surveys Ltd and will help inform any future works. https://t.co/9NlrnPLtCd

tweets.text: We are responding to a pollution incident at Cardinham Water, Bodmin following the theft of diesel oil from a distribution depot. Absorbent pads and booms have been deployed in the river to reduce any environmental impact. The watercourse is a tributary of the River Fowey. https://t.co/LyDV8vYubC
